body_html:
Did so. Advanced indexing still doesn't raise an exception on negative out-of-bounds indexes, but returns an arbitrary result:

⟫ python
Python 3.6.5 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Mar 29 2018, 18:21:58) 
[GCC 7.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.4.0a0+04c215b'
>>> torch.zeros(10)[-11]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
IndexError: index -11 is out of bounds for dimension 0 with size 10
>>> torch.zeros(10)[torch.LongTensor([-11])]

1.00000e-09 *
  1.8028
[torch.FloatTensor of size (1,)]

>>>

body:
Did so. Advanced indexing still doesn't raise an exception on negative out-of-bounds indexes, but returns an arbitrary result:
```
⟫ python
Python 3.6.5 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Mar 29 2018, 18:21:58) 
[GCC 7.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.4.0a0+04c215b'
>>> torch.zeros(10)[-11]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
IndexError: index -11 is out of bounds for dimension 0 with size 10
>>> torch.zeros(10)[torch.LongTensor([-11])]

1.00000e-09 *
  1.8028
[torch.FloatTensor of size (1,)]

>>> 
```
